evidence_span: Flat mill products of Zircaloy-4 and controlled-chemistry Zircaloy-2 were processed using different rolling schedules in order to generate different textures and other metallurgical conditions.

evidence_span: Tubular products of three heats of controlled-chemistry Zircaloy-2 were also processed using various thermo-mechanical parameters and different tube reduction schedules.

evidence_span: Samples were taken for 500 and $5 2 0 \mathrm { { ‰} }$ steam autoclave tests and texture and microstructure examination.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: Results showed that the nodular corrosion resistance for controlled-chemistry Zircaloy-2 was excellent, while that for Zircaloy-4 was rather poor.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: Results showed that the nodular corrosion resistance for controlled-chemistry Zircaloy-2 was excellent, while that for Zircaloy-4 was rather poor.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: The Zircaloy-2 tubeshell may be annealed up to $6 6 3 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } / 2 \mathrm { h }$ without detriment to the nodular corrosion resistance of the final size tubing if other fabrication variables are properly controlled.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: The optimum process for tube reducing is a high $Q$ ratio and high percent of reduction in area.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: The optimum process for tube reducing is a high $Q$ ratio and high percent of reduction in area.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: Neither $\beta$ quench nor $\alpha ~ + ~ \beta$ treatment after tube extrusion is required to produce cladding tube that is free of nodules in 500 or $5 2 0 \mathrm { ‰}$ autoclave tests.
process_step: tube extrusion, beta quench, alpha+beta treatment

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: Low basal pole densities are generally related to high corrosion weight gains.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: The accumulated annealing parameter, $\pmb { \Sigma A }$ , can generally predict the nodular corrosion behavior of the material, but it cannot account for the higher corrosion weight gain at an intermediate stage and lower weight gain at the final size.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: A depletion of these elements in the matrix or a large spacing between intermetallic precipitates causes poor nodular corrosion resistance.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_023_chunk1
evidence_span: The positive effect of cold work on the nodular corrosion resistance is attributed to increasing the yield strength of the substrate.

evidence_span: The positive effect of cold work on the nodular corrosion resistance is attributed to increasing the yield strength of the substrate.
